survey_name: Customer Satisfaction Survey for Ride-Sharing Services
survey_brief: This survey aims to gather feedback from users of ride-sharing services to understand their satisfaction levels, pain points, and preferences for future improvements.

questions.question_text: How frequently do you use ride-sharing services in a typical month?
questions.client_notes: This question helps segment users based on usage frequency. Use a single-choice radio button for clarity.

script.question_text: How frequently do you use ride-sharing services in a typical month?

questions.question_text: Which ride-sharing apps do you use regularly? (Select all that apply)
questions.client_notes: This question identifies platform preferences. Use checkboxes for multi-selection.

script.question_text: Which ride-sharing apps do you use regularly? (Select all that apply)

questions.question_text: What is your primary reason for using ride-sharing services?
questions.client_notes: This helps understand user motivations. Use a single-choice radio button with an optional open-text field for 'Other'.
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: SINGLE_CHOICE (radio buttons with optional open-text for 'Other')

script.question_text: What is your primary reason for using ride-sharing services?

questions.question_text: On a scale of 1-5, how satisfied are you with the overall ride-sharing experience? (1 = Very Dissatisfied, 5 = Very Satisfied)
questions.client_notes: Use a Likert scale for satisfaction measurement. Ensure the scale is clearly labeled.
questions.scripter_notes: Field type: SINGLE_CHOICE (radio buttons with scale labels)

script.question_text: On a scale of 1-5, how satisfied are you with the overall ride-sharing experience? (1 = Very Dissatisfied, 5 = Very Satisfied)

questions.question_text: What aspects of ride-sharing do you find most satisfying? (Select all that apply)
questions.client_notes: Use checkboxes for multi-selection. Include an 'Other' option for additional feedback.

script.question_text: What aspects of ride-sharing do you find most satisfying? (Select all that apply)

questions.question_text: What aspects of ride-sharing do you find least satisfying? (Select all that apply)
questions.client_notes: Use checkboxes for multi-selection. Include an 'Other' option for additional feedback.

script.question_text: What aspects of ride-sharing do you find least satisfying? (Select all that apply)

questions.question_text: How often do you experience issues with ride cancellations (by driver or rider)?
questions.client_notes: This helps assess reliability. Use a single-choice radio button.

script.question_text: How often do you experience issues with ride cancellations (by driver or rider)?

questions.question_text: What features would you like to see added to ride-sharing apps? (Open-ended)
questions.client_notes: This open-ended question allows for qualitative feedback. Ensure the text box is large enough for detailed responses.

script.question_text: What features would you like to see added to ride-sharing apps? (Open-ended)

questions.question_text: How important is sustainability (e.g., electric vehicles, carbon offset options) when choosing a ride-sharing service?
questions.client_notes: This assesses environmental concerns. Use a single-choice radio button with a Likert scale.

script.question_text: How important is sustainability (e.g., electric vehicles, carbon offset options) when choosing a ride-sharing service?

questions.question_text: Would you be willing to pay a small premium for more sustainable ride options (e.g., electric vehicles)?
answer_options: Maybe, depending on the price difference
questions.routing_logic: Shown if Q9 response is 'Moderately important' or higher
questions.client_notes: This follows up on sustainability interest. Use a single-choice radio button.

script.question_text: Would you be willing to pay a small premium for more sustainable ride options (e.g., electric vehicles)?
answer_options: Maybe, depending on the price difference
script.routing_logic: Shown if Q9 response is 'Moderately important' or higher
